job_title: Health Care Assistant in London, England

review_title: member of the non clinical team
pros: Ellern Mede is one of  the most open  minded and 'lively' customer-orientated places I have ever worked. Here, the patient really is the centre of everything and regardless of the type of staff, its the culture to go the extra mile for patients  and their families. We are expanding both sites and services and its to meet a shortage of eating disorder services. The heart is most definitely in the right place and our results for patients is heart warming. Perks are pretty good, especially attitude to ongoing professional education, an education fund, and mandatory and extra training. Personally I think there are good career opportunities.
cons: 115 staff to what will be just under 40 patients it seems like a great ratio. Everyone seems to feel stretched but its mainly that they are working with extra commitment. Overtime is very normal. I suppose it depends on your personal work ethic if you like that or not.

review_title: Senior management extremely poor, most front line staff excellent
pros:
Free tea and coffee in the staff room
Decent Christmas party with open bar
Psychologists tried to help nursing team with training and support which was valued
cons:
Significantly lower salary than colleagues in the NHS (bear in mind EMR treats NHS patients almost exclusively)
Poor quality facilities - for example, paper thin walls in most rooms with little privacy for patients undergoing treatment
No pay progression, proper pension provision and little access to external training
Many staff are family members or friends of either the senior management team or other staff members and there were several examples of inequitable promotions and hiring - I do not believe the organisation spends money on external recruitment which is to its detriment.
